<Link id="l00109" /><CodeLine lineNumber="109"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Note: the DataLayout is LLVMContext specific because it has an</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00110" /><CodeLine lineNumber="110"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// internal cache based on type pointers. It makes unsafe to reuse the</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00251" /><CodeLine lineNumber="251"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// load it into memory.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00252" /><CodeLine lineNumber="252"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00253" /><CodeLine lineNumber="253"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// When this function has completed, all code and data for the specified</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00256" /><CodeLine lineNumber="256"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// and all memory will be readable and writable but not executable.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00257" /><CodeLine lineNumber="257"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00258" /><CodeLine lineNumber="258"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// This function is primarily useful when generating code for an external</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00263" /><CodeLine lineNumber="263"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00350" /><CodeLine lineNumber="350"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// getPointerToFunction - The different EE&#39;s represent function bodies in</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00360" /><CodeLine lineNumber="360"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// getPointerToFunctionOrStub - If the specified function has been</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00364" /><CodeLine lineNumber="364"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00365" /><CodeLine lineNumber="365"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// This function is deprecated for the MCJIT execution engine.  Use</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00367" /><CodeLine lineNumber="367" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/executionengine/#a3aae274d0f4e7b494ee7807374f5c32b"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">virtual</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/executionengine/#a3aae274d0f4e7b494ee7807374f5c32b">getPointerToFunctionOrStub</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/function">Function</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#a96d73bbd7af15cb1fc38c3f4a3bd82e9">F</a>) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00368" /><CodeLine lineNumber="368"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Default implementation, just codegen the function.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00369" /><CodeLine lineNumber="369"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/executionengine/#a54f6dc15011951227ed4065f2e934f90">getPointerToFunction</a>(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#a96d73bbd7af15cb1fc38c3f4a3bd82e9">F</a>);</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00427" /><CodeLine lineNumber="427"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// setProcessAllSections (MCJIT Only): By default, only sections that are</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00430" /><CodeLine lineNumber="430"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// RuntimeDyld to pass all sections to its RTDyldMemoryManager regardless</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00431" /><CodeLine lineNumber="431"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// of whether they are &quot;required to execute&quot; in the usual sense.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00432" /><CodeLine lineNumber="432"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00433" /><CodeLine lineNumber="433"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Rationale: Some MCJIT clients want to be able to inspect metadata</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00434" /><CodeLine lineNumber="434"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// sections (e.g. Dwarf, Stack-maps) to enable functionality or analyze</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00435" /><CodeLine lineNumber="435"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// performance. Passing these sections to the memory manager allows the</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00445" /><CodeLine lineNumber="445"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// DisableLazyCompilation - When lazy compilation is off (the default), the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00446" /><CodeLine lineNumber="446"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// JIT will eagerly compile every function reachable from the argument to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00447" /><CodeLine lineNumber="447"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// getPointerToFunction.  If lazy compilation is turned on, the JIT will only</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00450" /><CodeLine lineNumber="450"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// stubs are still around, and one of those stubs is called, the program will</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00451" /><CodeLine lineNumber="451"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// abort.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00452" /><CodeLine lineNumber="452"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00453" /><CodeLine lineNumber="453"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// In order to safely compile lazily in a threaded program, the user must</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00454" /><CodeLine lineNumber="454"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// ensure that 1) only one thread at a time can call any particular lazy</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00455" /><CodeLine lineNumber="455"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// stub, and 2) any thread modifying LLVM IR must hold the JIT&#39;s lock</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00456" /><CodeLine lineNumber="456"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// (ExecutionEngine::lock) or otherwise ensure that no other thread calls a</span></CodeLine>
